{{Wireless embedded system |brand=GL.iNet |model=GL-AR750 |asin=B07712LKJM |newegg=9SIAFN26TX8272 |fcc_date=12/06/2017 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |type=travel router, repeater, |fcc_id=2AFIW-AR750 |pwr_v=5 |pwr_amp=2 |pwr_conn=USB Female Micro-B |cpu1_brand=Qualcomm Atheros |cpu1_model=QCA9531;QCA9531-BL3A, PK64CB75, 1640, TAIWAN; |cpu1_cspeed=650 |fla1=16 |ram1=128 |expansion_if_types=USB 2.0, |expansion_usb_num=1 |serial=yes,, 7-pin header,, |wi1_chip1_brand=Qualcomm Atheros |wi1_chip1_model=QCA9531;QCA9531-BL3A, PK64CB75, 1640, TAIWAN; |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |wi2_chip1_brand=Qualcomm Atheros |wi2_chip1_model=QCA9887 |wi2_802dot11_protocols=an+ac |wi2_ant_conn=U.FL |wi2_txchains=1 |wi2_rxchains=1 |wi2_sstreams=1 |eth_cpu=true |sw_cpu=true |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=2 |wan_ports=1 |flags=MicroSD Card slot, |stock_os=Linux;;OpenWrt; |tp_firmware=LEDE, OpenWrt, Gargoyle, |802dot11_protocols=abgn+ac |default_ssid=GL-AR750-XXX |default_ip=192.168.8.1 }} {{TagLine|750M Travel AC Router}} [[File:ar750_shop-7.jpg|600px]] ----
:• '''433''' Mbps - 1SS 5GHz [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_802.11ac#Data_rates_and_speed 802.11ac] (80MHz chan.), :• '''300''' Mbps - 2SS 2.4GHz [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_802.11n-2009#Data_rates 802.11n] (40MHz chan.) = '''''750 Mbps'' class'''
==Official Supports== :{{ProductPage|https://www.gl-inet.com/ar750/}} :[https://store.gl-inet.com/collections/travel-routers/products/gl-ar750-travel-ac-router Official Shop] :[https://forum.gl-inet.com/ Official Forum] ==Features== * Powered by [[Qualcomm Atheros]] QCA9531 WiSoC (@650MHz CPU) * 300Mbps (2.4GHz) + 433Mbps (5GHz) high speed * 16MB (NOR) Flash; 128MB (DDR2) RAM * Support external storage up to 128GB * OpenWrt/LEDE pre-installed * Small, light, easy to use ==Mention== *[https://forum.lede-project.org/t/best-no-brainer-easy-to-flash-easy-to-buy-cheap-router-with-usb/8637/7 ''LEDE Project forum''] "GL.inet has just released their new GL-AR750. I do not know that any one actually has seen :these yet, but all their products come with OpenWrt pre-installed, so upgrading is easy. GL.inet products come with their proprietary GUI over OpenWrt (you can use either). All the older products are available in LEDE (no GL.inet GUI), however the AR300M :does not have a supported NAND version in LEDE, just the NOR. GL.inet offers “clean” firmware (no GL.inet GUI) and there is a version of the NAND :on OpenWrt). Their 2.263 firmware contains the KRACK patches." ==Images== File:AR750-board.jpg|Board File:ar750_router.jpg|Ports File:ar750_router_tf-card.jpg|TF Card [[Has images::internal| ]][[Has images::external| ]] __NOTOC__
